name: ExperienceTO: Sunnyside Historical Tour
description: Join us for a public tour that will be a good experience for anyone; whether you're 8 or 80 years old, and whether you're a curious local, solo traveler, backpacker, part of a small groups of friends, or a newcomer.

name: Krampus Ball
description:
Returning for the thirteenth year!  

Toronto's Alternative Christmas Costume Party that celebrates the darker side of the holidays with an eclectic spectacle of costumes, music, aerial works, and avant-garde burlesque performances. 

The Krampus Ball is a highly anticipated annual party of frightful yet beautiful costumes and makeup. Attendees are encouraged to dress up; whether it be in demon-wear as an homage to the namesake yuletide demon himself, or another festive being such as a nutcracker or a sugarplum fairy. Entertainment will include a wide range of music from alternative rock, black metal, and eerie theremin serenades to break beats, deep bass and drum n bass.

name: Holiday Lamplight Tours at Spadina Museum
description: Experience the magic of the season with a tour of Spadina Museum by lamplight. See the lavish 55-room mansion fully decorated for the holidays, just as it was in the 1920s. An experienced guide will lead you through this rare opportunity to explore the house by night. As you arrive, take in a 1920s silent film and enjoy a glass of non-alcoholic punch recreated from a historic recipe. Light up the season with the magic of the winter solstice, spreading joy, peace and festive cheer at Toronto History Museums!

name: Merry Creepmas Market
description:
The best way to have a merry little Creepmas is to fill it with the coolest, creepiest things!

We'll be hosting over 35 artists and artisans featuring the most wonderfully weird, spooky, and macabre creations! Sip on a drink from our bar, while you browse.

name: Youth Arts Mentorship at Mackenzie House
description:
Beginning December 6th, discover the vibrant voices of five young Toronto artists under the mentorship of Blue M.B.K. Inspired by the theme of "Home," young artists explored personal stories through sequential images. 

Working in the historic print shop, youth blended traditional printing with hand-drawn animation. This exhibition presents flip-book animations that merge past and present, bringing intimate narratives to life within this historic setting.

Turkish-born Toronto artist Blue M.B.K. blends film, photography, illustration, and animation to create socially engaged visual stories and nurture communities.

name: A Ceremony of Christmas

location.name: Runnymede United Church, 432 Runnymede Road, Toronto

description:
A joyful and festive concert featuring Juno Award-winning harpist Erica Goodman. 

The celebration will continue with Poulenc's Quatre Motets pour Le temp de Noel and Louis Applebaum's Carols of French Canada, and Winter's Peak, a new piece by author Sarah Henstra and artistic director Henry Renglich will be premiered.  

Choir members include: Mélissa Danis, soprano, David Finneran, bass, Grace Hakala, soprano, Lauren Halász, alto, Pete Oundjian, tenor, Jeremy Scinocca, tenor, Mikhail Shemet, baritone, Amanda Weatherall, alto.

With accompanist Carl Steinhauser, Artistic Director Henry Renglich and Assistant Conductor Mélissa Danis.

name: The Christmas Story

location.name: The Church of the Holy Trinity

description:
One of Toronto's oldest holiday traditions. 

First staged here in 1938, this pageant began in St. Martin-in-the-Fields church in London, England in 1928. Queen Elizabeth and her sister Margaret were taken to see it when they were little girls. The story of the Nativity is told through a series of narrated scenes linked by beautiful organ music and carols from an unseen choir.   

Close to 50 volunteers, including babies who take turns playing the role of baby Jesus, perform in the cast. The Church of the Holy Trinity, a 178-year-old architectural treasure, brings its own charm to the show.  ASL interpretation is available on Friday, December 19th.

name: Little Ice Castle Workshop
description:
Step into a world of winter wonder and build your own miniature ice castle!

Guided by our creative team, each participant will receive a miniature kit complete with all the materials and instructions needed to assemble and decorate your Little Ice Castle. It's your chance to bring a little winter magic to life in miniature scale.

Reserve your spot before this winter workshop melts away!

name: Guided Walking Tour in Rouge National Urban Park

location.name: Twyn Rivers Day Use Area - Rouge National Urban Park

description:
Join us to discover the park's natural, cultural and agricultural stories with friendly and knowledgeable volunteer leaders and staff. 

We have something for everyone, wildlife sightings, quiet nature walks, discovering the past, fitness challenges or meeting new people!

name: Lori Cullen and Michelle Willis
description:
Canadian songwriters Lori Cullen and Michelle Willis perform an intimate collection of songs from their new records, Rich is the Wanderer and The Thunder and the Bay. 

The night will feature a sophisticated and soul-filling double bill, solo and together, highlighting their musical chemistry, warmth, and humour. Longtime friends, their ease with one another brings a rare kind of trust and playfulness to the stage, deepening the emotional resonance of the music.

Lori Cullen is a JUNO-nominated Canadian songwriter whose pure vocal style captivates listeners.

Michelle Willis is a Toronto-raised singer-songwriter, pianist, and guitarist currently based in Scotland.

name: Ahmed Moneka & Friends at DROM Taberna
description:
Arabic folk melodies, informed by contemporary funk, soul and jazz.

A musical representation of Juno-nominated Ahmed Moneka's journey from Baghdad, Iraq to the heart of Toronto, Canada.

Drawing on his Afro-Sufi-Iraqi music heritage, Juno-nominated Ahmed Moneka delivers a joyful and transcendent mix of African grooves and Arabic folk melodies, informed by contemporary funk, soul and jazz. Reflecting on his personal journey as an artist, actor and activist who arrived in Toronto from Baghdad as a refugee after an appearance in a movie about gay rights, Moneka and his all-star global ensemble draw listeners into an ecstatic celebration of life, exploring love in all its forms alongside nostalgia for one's home, through original compositions and Middle Eastern classics.

name: Montgomery's Inn Winter Tea
description: This December, Montgomery's Inn presents a winter tea with our program partner Islington United Church, inviting visitors and their families to enjoy a selection of seasonal sweets and bottomless tea in celebration of the holiday season.

name: Etobicoke-Lakeshore Santa Claus Parade 2025
description:
A must-see for anyone living in South Etobicoke! 

Come out and see the floats, the bands, the community groups, your favourite walking characters, Santa's elves and animal friends and of course the Jolly Elf himself, Santa Claus!

organizer.name: Lakeshore Village and Long Branch BIA

name: The Local Love Holiday Market
description:
Celebrate the season with two cozy weekends of shopping small and supporting Toronto's local artisans. Discover handmade gifts, festive goods, and treats created by talented makers from our community.

Enjoy our cheerful cash bar featuring local beer from Steadfast Brewing Co., seasonal wines, and non-alcoholic options. Plus, tarot reader and author Sabrina Scott will be offering readings to give you a glimpse into what 2026 may hold.

Come sip, shop, and share some local love this holiday season.

name: Fossil Quest: Scavenger Hunt
description:
Dino Detectives Unite! Get ready to travel through time on a prehistoric adventure scavenger hunt. 

From the first fierce predators to the mighty giants of the Late Cretaceous, you'll uncover dino facts, solve ancient puzzles, and test your paleontology skills. Gather your team of family and friends, channel your inner explorer, and race through millions of years of history. No time machine required.

name: Eighth Street Orchestra live at DROM Taberna
description: The biggest little brass band on the street.

name: East End Arts Holiday Arts Market 2025
description:
Join East End Arts for our second annual Holiday Arts Market taking place at our space, St. Matthew's Clubhouse! Come and support a great lineup of local artists who sell items that they personally make or design themselves.

For the warm cozy holiday vibes there will be holiday music and mulled wine (for sale) on the porch, with sweet treats of hot apple cider and cookies available inside. We hope you'll come by and support east Toronto artists and your east Toronto arts service organization.

East End Arts will be collecting nonperishable food items at our Holiday Market, which will then be donated to a local Food Bank, Nourish East End. If you would like to participate simply bring your item(s) with you and we will collect them at the door. Thank you!

See website for artist lineup and more details.

name: Moss Park Market
description:
Building Roots' Moss Park Market is a "Give-What-You-Can fresh produce market open every Saturday for residents of the Moss Park community. We provide a variety of fresh produce sourced from local suppliers and farms. We also prioritize culturally significant foods, engaging with the community to ensure we offer the items that are most needed.

Community members in Moss Park can access food at the market at no cost. If they are able, we encourage them to make a small donation towards the cost of the food. Any funds received are reinvested directly back into the market, with the aim of creating a fully self-sustaining community resource.

name: One Love Festive Market:  Follow Your Heart
description: Fort York's historic Blue Barracks will be transformed into a warm, love-filled festive market under the theme "Follow Your Heart "  The event will bring together neighbours, families, and visitors for a joyful weekend that celebrates creativity, culture, and community — a reflection of Toronto's diversity and spirit of togetherness.   This Community Holiday Market has a diverse collection of food and artisan vendors.  Children's activities include a hot chocolate station and cookie decorating workshops.

name: 12th Annual Leslieville Christmas Pop-Up Market
description:
Explore local makers, enjoy festive experiences, and soak in the holiday atmosphere in Toronto's East End.

Look forward to shopping for unique gifts, decor, art, jewelry, gourmet treats and more from over 60 local small artisan vendors. Bring the family to Santa's Village and enjoy taking holiday photos. Try out our hands-on experiences and activities. We'll be spinning the best music and spreading the seasonal joy!

name: PAI Holiday Market 2025
description:
Step into the magic of the season as we transform into a lively holiday market! 

Explore vibrant stalls inspired by Thailand's bustling street markets and discover unique local gifts, treats, and surprises. 

Enjoy our fan-favourite Lucky Tree game and sample culinary delights as Chef Nuit and our culinary team serve up some special market-only dishes, including Thai-Style Deep-Fried Pork and Thai Yellow Curry Chicken. 

All net proceeds from our market food sales and funds from the Lucky Tree game proceeds will support building a facility for underprivileged students to host youth and educational programs in Chef Nuit's hometown in Northern Thailand. 

Join us for festive fun, delicious eats, and a day of giving back!

name: Nagata Shachu: Oto no Nami 音の波 (Sound Waves)

location.name: The Fleck at Harbourfront Centre Theatre

description:
Now in the 28th season. 

This performance will spotlight the thunderous and raw power of the taiko, played with unbounded energy, discipline and passion that Nagata Shachu has become renowned for. The finale piece will be a monumental and physical piece using the largest taiko drums.

Oto no Nami 音の波 (Sound Waves) will feature Nagata Shachu's timeless signature works in addition to several new compositions. Oto no Nami will take listeners on a journey from ancient Japan to the present day through rapturous rhythms, earth shaking beats, and soulful melodies of bamboo flutes and the three-stringed shamisen.

name: Youngplace Holiday Art Fair
description:
We are excited to announce our return!

Join three floors full ov crafters and creatives in this amazing holiday market filled with all kinds of art!

With the aim to support local talent within our diverse communities, in the art market meets gallery exhibition! If you're an artist, in need of a holiday gift, or just want to explore, we encourage you to visit us, browse crafts and artworks for sale, and enjoy some holiday spirit!

Join us in the heart of West Queen West and meet over twenty-five amazing artists and creators. Featuring live pottery demonstrations by Toronto Potters, holiday ornament making, an empanada cafe and more!

name: ExperienceTO: Sunnyside Historical Tour
description: Join us for a public tour that will be a good experience for anyone; whether you're 8 or 80 years old, and whether you're a curious local, solo traveler, backpacker, part of a small groups of friends, or a newcomer.

name: Adonis Rose and the New Orleans Jazz Orchestra present: A Crescent City Christmas

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
The celebrated New Orleans Jazz Orchestra performs a special program of your favourite holiday songs done with New Orleans style.

Founded in 2002, the orchestra celebrates the American jazz portfolio with an emphasis on developing the New Orleans jazz scene. Led by Grammy Award-winning drummer and artistic director Adonis Rose, the group is known for their versatility and high energy performances.

After the concert, enjoy a beverage and more music!

name: Write for Rights
description:
Come join us and write a letter in support of human rights around the world.

Write for Rights is the world's largest human rights event, marked each year on International Human Rights Day. We will be joining supporters in over 170 countries to support 10 individuals or groups in Cambodia, China, Ecuador, Honduras, Kyrgyzstan, Madagascar, Myanmar, Norway, South Africa, Tunisia and more.

Special guest speaker Michael Lynk, lawyer, professor and former UN Special Rapporteur for human rights in the Occupied Palestinian Territory will be joining us in the afternoon.

There will be activities for children and youth and light refreshments will be served.

Let's write together!

name: Merry Creepmas Market
description: A holiday-themed artisan marketplace for the wonderfully weird.

name: Bleecker - Wellesley Winter Market

location.name: Toronto Community Housing - O.N.E Community Market

description:
Join us for a festive winter market with free food (limited quantities), raffle prizes and family-friendly activities! 

We have some hair products, clothing, jewelry, and stained glass art work that would be perfect gift items for the holiday! Come and support the local vendors from the Bleecker-Wellesley Community and nearby communities.

name: Yorkgate Mall Holiday Market
description: We'll be featuring a mix of small businesses (personalized gifts, fresh baked goods, desserts, condiments, and more) alongside several free activities for the family to enjoy. Kids get to snap & take a free pic with Santa and receive complimentary surprises. The location in the Jane & Finch community helps to foster relationships between the public and business owners while creating a safe, warm indoor space to enjoy.

name: Éphémère, by Manela
description:
Discover the captivating world of Manela, featuring Marie-Neige Lavigne, Marin St-Pierre Paiement, Jean-Félix Mailloux, and Aaron Dollman.

The group presents its fourth album, Éphémère, where violin, guitar, double bass, and percussion blend to create a rich and distinctive sound, a unique fusion of jazz, folk, rock, and chamber music.

name: Barbara Ann Scott Ice Skating Trail Celebration

location.name: Barbara Ann Scott Ice Skating Trail

description:
Celebrate the season! 

Enjoy free skate lending, live music, festive photo ops, fit pits, s'mores by the rink and more fun activities for all ages!

name: Tour of The Bee Shop

address.streetAddress: 1340 Bloor Street West, Torotno, ON M6H 1P2

description:
Try out this fun opportunity to make and keep a mini beeswax candle, do an Ontario honey tasting of three different honeys and a tour of the rooftop apiary and its zodiacal pollinator garden. Learn information honeybees and how they help to ensure our nation's food supply. 

A honey beverage will be served and a mention of the health benefits of honey and other products of the beehive.

name: A Christmas Carol
description:
Now in its seventh festive year this immersive experience is returning to enchant Toronto audiences! 

Set in the historic and picturesque Campbell House Museum, this unique and critically-acclaimed theatrical production invites audience members to step into the world of Victorian England and follow flinty miser Ebenezer Scrooge on his ghostly journey of redemption. A mirthful medley of magic, music, and the macabre and lauded by many, this is the perfect holiday experience!

name: New Hope Fellowship Christmas Market - Gift from Above
description:
"Every good and perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of the heavenly lights, who does not change like shifting shadows." James 1:17 NIV

Join us for our Annual Christmas Market. Celebrate the season with us and enjoy:
- Unique, handmade gifts from local vendors
- A delicious selection of foods, including Asian street food and festive treats
- Fun activities for all ages
- A door raffle with amazing prizes

Everyone's welcome! Bring your family and friends to share in the joy.

All proceeds from the market will go toward supporting Good Shepherd Ministries (https://goodshepherd.ca/).

name: Downtown Top Ranking
description:
Join us for an authentic celebration of original Roots and Culture and Rockas Reggae in true Rub-A-Dub style. 

This annual community appreciation event spotlights crucial selections from DJ John Ringo, Di Arsonist, Fyah Rootz, and the Black Heart iNiversal Sound, bringing pure vibes to the heart of the city.

Holding firm to Toronto's reggae foundation, the night also features a live late-night riddim section powered by Studio1806 Middle East, with drums, bass, and keys performed by some of the city's top musicians. The session runs in an open live format, welcoming all artists to step forward and chant, sing, or toast pon di mic.

Expereience pure culture. Real community. Keeping the roots alive.

name: The Horables live at DROM Taberna
description: A genuine staff favourite, The Horables play an eclectic mix of Klezmer, Jazz Manouche, polkas, Gypsy dance tunes and rags from the age of steam.

name: Ronley Teper and the Lipliners
description:
Well-known for her genre-blending unabashed, experimental live performances, alongside her rotating collective of improvisors known as The Lipliners. 

A singer-songwriter who's sound blends together folk, jazz, funk, orchestral pop, post rock, cabaret and the blues. Ronley creates whimsical, surreal, and engaging contemporary art through music. It's an approach free of inhibition that hearkens to other trailblazers like Zappa or Waits.
